00055 /*****************************************************************************
00056  *
00057  * Page operations.
00058  *
00059  */
00060 
00061 static void vvp_page_fini_common(struct vvp_page *vpg)
00062 {
00063         struct page *vmpage = vpg->vpg_page;
00064 
00065         LASSERT(vmpage != NULL);
00066         page_cache_release(vmpage);
00067 }
00068 
00069 static void vvp_page_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00070                           struct cl_page_slice *slice)
00071 {
00072         struct vvp_page *vpg     = cl2vvp_page(slice);
00073         struct page     *vmpage  = vpg->vpg_page;
00074 
00075         /*
00076          * vmpage->private was already cleared when page was moved into
00077          * VPG_FREEING state.
00078          */
00079         LASSERT((struct cl_page *)vmpage->private != slice->cpl_page);
00080         vvp_page_fini_common(vpg);
00081 }
00082 
00083 static int vvp_page_own(const struct lu_env *env,
00084                         const struct cl_page_slice *slice, struct cl_io *io,
00085                         int nonblock)
00086 {
00087         struct vvp_page *vpg    = cl2vvp_page(slice);
00088         struct page     *vmpage = vpg->vpg_page;
00089 
00090         LASSERT(vmpage != NULL);
00091         if (nonblock) {
00092                 if (!trylock_page(vmpage))
00093                         return -EAGAIN;
00094 
00095                 if (unlikely(PageWriteback(vmpage))) {
00096                         unlock_page(vmpage);
00097                         return -EAGAIN;
00098                 }
00099 
00100                 return 0;
00101         }
00102 
00103         lock_page(vmpage);
00104         wait_on_page_writeback(vmpage);
00105 
00106         return 0;
00107 }
00108 
00109 static void vvp_page_assume(const struct lu_env *env,
00110                             const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00111                             struct cl_io *unused)
00112 {
00113         struct page *vmpage = cl2vm_page(slice);
00114 
00115         LASSERT(vmpage != NULL);
00116         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00117         wait_on_page_writeback(vmpage);
00118 }
00119 
00120 static void vvp_page_unassume(const struct lu_env *env,
00121                               const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00122                               struct cl_io *unused)
00123 {
00124         struct page *vmpage = cl2vm_page(slice);
00125 
00126         LASSERT(vmpage != NULL);
00127         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00128 }
00129 
00130 static void vvp_page_disown(const struct lu_env *env,
00131                             const struct cl_page_slice *slice, struct cl_io *io)
00132 {
00133         struct page *vmpage = cl2vm_page(slice);
00134 
00135         LASSERT(vmpage != NULL);
00136         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00137 
00138         unlock_page(cl2vm_page(slice));
00139 }
00140 
00141 static void vvp_page_discard(const struct lu_env *env,
00142                              const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00143                              struct cl_io *unused)
00144 {
00145         struct page     *vmpage = cl2vm_page(slice);
00146         struct vvp_page *vpg    = cl2vvp_page(slice);
00147 
00148         LASSERT(vmpage != NULL);
00149         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00150 
00151         if (vpg->vpg_defer_uptodate && !vpg->vpg_ra_used)
00152                 ll_ra_stats_inc(vmpage->mapping->host, RA_STAT_DISCARDED);
00153 
00154         ll_invalidate_page(vmpage);
00155 }
00156 
00157 static void vvp_page_delete(const struct lu_env *env,
00158                             const struct cl_page_slice *slice)
00159 {
00160         struct page      *vmpage = cl2vm_page(slice);
00161         struct inode     *inode  = vmpage->mapping->host;
00162         struct cl_object *obj    = slice->cpl_obj;
00163         struct cl_page   *page   = slice->cpl_page;
00164         int refc;
00165 
00166         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00167         LASSERT((struct cl_page *)vmpage->private == page);
00168         LASSERT(inode == vvp_object_inode(obj));
00169 
00170         /* Drop the reference count held in vvp_page_init */
00171         refc = atomic_dec_return(&page->cp_ref);
00172         LASSERTF(refc >= 1, "page = %p, refc = %d\n", page, refc);
00173 
00174         ClearPageUptodate(vmpage);
00175         ClearPagePrivate(vmpage);
00176         vmpage->private = 0;
00177         /*
00178          * Reference from vmpage to cl_page is removed, but the reference back
00179          * is still here. It is removed later in vvp_page_fini().
00180          */
00181 }
00182 
00183 static void vvp_page_export(const struct lu_env *env,
00184                             const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00185                             int uptodate)
00186 {
00187         struct page *vmpage = cl2vm_page(slice);
00188 
00189         LASSERT(vmpage != NULL);
00190         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00191         if (uptodate)
00192                 SetPageUptodate(vmpage);
00193         else
00194                 ClearPageUptodate(vmpage);
00195 }
00196 
00197 static int vvp_page_is_vmlocked(const struct lu_env *env,
00198                                 const struct cl_page_slice *slice)
00199 {
00200         return PageLocked(cl2vm_page(slice)) ? -EBUSY : -ENODATA;
00201 }
00202 
00203 static int vvp_page_prep_read(const struct lu_env *env,
00204                               const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00205                               struct cl_io *unused)
00206 {
00207         ENTRY;
00208         /* Skip the page already marked as PG_uptodate. */
00209         RETURN(PageUptodate(cl2vm_page(slice)) ? -EALREADY : 0);
00210 }
00211 
00212 static int vvp_page_prep_write(const struct lu_env *env,
00213                                const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00214                                struct cl_io *unused)
00215 {
00216         struct page *vmpage = cl2vm_page(slice);
00217 
00218         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00219         LASSERT(!PageDirty(vmpage));
00220 
00221         set_page_writeback(vmpage);
00222 
00223         return 0;
00224 }
00225 
00232 static void vvp_vmpage_error(struct inode *inode, struct page *vmpage, int ioret)
00233 {
00234         struct vvp_object *obj = cl_inode2vvp(inode);
00235 
00236         if (ioret == 0) {
00237                 ClearPageError(vmpage);
00238                 obj->vob_discard_page_warned = 0;
00239         } else {
00240                 SetPageError(vmpage);
00241                 if (ioret == -ENOSPC)
00242                         set_bit(AS_ENOSPC, &inode->i_mapping->flags);
00243                 else
00244                         set_bit(AS_EIO, &inode->i_mapping->flags);
00245 
00246                 if ((ioret == -ESHUTDOWN || ioret == -EINTR) &&
00247                      obj->vob_discard_page_warned == 0) {
00248                         obj->vob_discard_page_warned = 1;
00249                         ll_dirty_page_discard_warn(vmpage, ioret);
00250                 }
00251         }
00252 }
00253 
00254 static void vvp_page_completion_read(const struct lu_env *env,
00255                                      const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00256                                      int ioret)
00257 {
00258         struct vvp_page *vpg    = cl2vvp_page(slice);
00259         struct page     *vmpage = vpg->vpg_page;
00260         struct cl_page  *page   = slice->cpl_page;
00261         struct inode    *inode  = vvp_object_inode(page->cp_obj);
00262         ENTRY;
00263 
00264         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00265         CL_PAGE_HEADER(D_PAGE, env, page, "completing READ with %d\n", ioret);
00266 
00267         if (vpg->vpg_defer_uptodate)
00268                 ll_ra_count_put(ll_i2sbi(inode), 1);
00269 
00270         if (ioret == 0)  {
00271                 if (!vpg->vpg_defer_uptodate)
00272                         cl_page_export(env, page, 1);
00273         } else {
00274                 vpg->vpg_defer_uptodate = 0;
00275         }
00276 
00277         if (page->cp_sync_io == NULL)
00278                 unlock_page(vmpage);
00279 
00280         EXIT;
00281 }
00282 
00283 static void vvp_page_completion_write(const struct lu_env *env,
00284                                       const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00285                                       int ioret)
00286 {
00287         struct vvp_page *vpg    = cl2vvp_page(slice);
00288         struct cl_page  *pg     = slice->cpl_page;
00289         struct page     *vmpage = vpg->vpg_page;
00290         ENTRY;
00291 
00292         LASSERT(ergo(pg->cp_sync_io != NULL, PageLocked(vmpage)));
00293         LASSERT(PageWriteback(vmpage));
00294 
00295         CL_PAGE_HEADER(D_PAGE, env, pg, "completing WRITE with %d\n", ioret);
00296 
00297         /*
00298          * Only mark the page error only when it's an async write because
00299          * applications won't wait for IO to finish.
00300          */
00301         if (pg->cp_sync_io == NULL)
00302                 vvp_vmpage_error(vvp_object_inode(pg->cp_obj), vmpage, ioret);
00303 
00304         end_page_writeback(vmpage);
00305         EXIT;
00306 }
00307 
00322 static int vvp_page_make_ready(const struct lu_env *env,
00323                                const struct cl_page_slice *slice)
00324 {
00325         struct page *vmpage = cl2vm_page(slice);
00326         struct cl_page *pg = slice->cpl_page;
00327         int result = 0;
00328 
00329         lock_page(vmpage);
00330         if (clear_page_dirty_for_io(vmpage)) {
00331                 LASSERT(pg->cp_state == CPS_CACHED);
00332                 /* This actually clears the dirty bit in the radix
00333                  * tree. */
00334                 set_page_writeback(vmpage);
00335                 CL_PAGE_HEADER(D_PAGE, env, pg, "readied\n");
00336         } else if (pg->cp_state == CPS_PAGEOUT) {
00337                 /* is it possible for osc_flush_async_page() to already
00338                  * make it ready? */
00339                 result = -EALREADY;
00340         } else {
00341                 CL_PAGE_DEBUG(D_ERROR, env, pg, "Unexpecting page state %d.\n",
00342                               pg->cp_state);
00343                 LBUG();
00344         }
00345         unlock_page(vmpage);
00346         RETURN(result);
00347 }
00348 
00349 static int vvp_page_print(const struct lu_env *env,
00350                           const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00351                           void *cookie, lu_printer_t printer)
00352 {
00353         struct vvp_page *vpg    = cl2vvp_page(slice);
00354         struct page     *vmpage = vpg->vpg_page;
00355 
00356         (*printer)(env, cookie, LUSTRE_VVP_NAME"-page@%p(%d:%d) "
00357                    "vm@%p ",
00358                    vpg, vpg->vpg_defer_uptodate, vpg->vpg_ra_used, vmpage);
00359 
00360         if (vmpage != NULL) {
00361                 (*printer)(env, cookie, "%lx %d:%d %lx %lu %slru",
00362                            (long)vmpage->flags, page_count(vmpage),
00363                            page_mapcount(vmpage), vmpage->private,
00364                            page_index(vmpage),
00365                            list_empty(&vmpage->lru) ? "not-" : "");
00366         }
00367 
00368         (*printer)(env, cookie, "\n");
00369 
00370         return 0;
00371 }
00372 
00373 static int vvp_page_fail(const struct lu_env *env,
00374                          const struct cl_page_slice *slice)
00375 {
00376         /*
00377          * Cached read?
00378          */
00379         LBUG();
00380 
00381         return 0;
00382 }

00384 static const struct cl_page_operations vvp_page_ops = {
00385         .cpo_own           = vvp_page_own,
00386         .cpo_assume        = vvp_page_assume,
00387         .cpo_unassume      = vvp_page_unassume,
00388         .cpo_disown        = vvp_page_disown,
00389         .cpo_discard       = vvp_page_discard,
00390         .cpo_delete        = vvp_page_delete,
00391         .cpo_export        = vvp_page_export,
00392         .cpo_is_vmlocked   = vvp_page_is_vmlocked,
00393         .cpo_fini          = vvp_page_fini,
00394         .cpo_print         = vvp_page_print,
00395         .io = {
00396                 [CRT_READ] = {
00397                         .cpo_prep       = vvp_page_prep_read,
00398                         .cpo_completion = vvp_page_completion_read,
00399                         .cpo_make_ready = vvp_page_fail,
00400                 },
00401                 [CRT_WRITE] = {
00402                         .cpo_prep       = vvp_page_prep_write,
00403                         .cpo_completion = vvp_page_completion_write,
00404                         .cpo_make_ready = vvp_page_make_ready,
00405                 },
00406         },
00407 };

00409 static int vvp_transient_page_prep(const struct lu_env *env,
00410                                    const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00411                                    struct cl_io *unused)
00412 {
00413         ENTRY;
00414         /* transient page should always be sent. */
00415         RETURN(0);
00416 }

00418 static void vvp_transient_page_verify(const struct cl_page *page)
00419 {
00420 }

00422 static int vvp_transient_page_own(const struct lu_env *env,
00423                                   const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00424                                   struct cl_io *unused, int nonblock)
00425 {
00426         vvp_transient_page_verify(slice->cpl_page);
00427         return 0;
00428 }

00432                                       struct cl_io *unused)
00433 {
00434         vvp_transient_page_verify(slice->cpl_page);

00438                                         const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00439                                         struct cl_io *unused)

00441         vvp_transient_page_verify(slice->cpl_page);

00444 static void vvp_transient_page_disown(const struct lu_env *env,
00445                                       const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00446                                       struct cl_io *unused)
00447 {
00448         vvp_transient_page_verify(slice->cpl_page);

00450 
00451 static void vvp_transient_page_discard(const struct lu_env *env,
00452                                        const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00453                                        struct cl_io *unused)
00454 {
00455         struct cl_page *page = slice->cpl_page;
00456 
00457         vvp_transient_page_verify(slice->cpl_page);
00458 
00459         /*
00460          * For transient pages, remove it from the radix tree.
00461          */
00462         cl_page_delete(env, page);
00463 }
00464 
00465 static int vvp_transient_page_is_vmlocked(const struct lu_env *env,
00466                                           const struct cl_page_slice *slice)
00467 {
00468         struct inode    *inode = vvp_object_inode(slice->cpl_obj);
00469         int     locked;
00470 
00471         locked = !mutex_trylock(&inode->i_mutex);
00472         if (!locked)
00473                 mutex_unlock(&inode->i_mutex);
00474         return locked ? -EBUSY : -ENODATA;
00475 }
00476 
00477 static void
00478 vvp_transient_page_completion(const struct lu_env *env,
00479                               const struct cl_page_slice *slice,
00480                               int ioret)
00481 {
00482         vvp_transient_page_verify(slice->cpl_page);
00483 }
00484 
00485 static void vvp_transient_page_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00486                                     struct cl_page_slice *slice)
00487 {
00488         struct vvp_page *vpg = cl2vvp_page(slice);
00489         struct cl_page *clp = slice->cpl_page;
00490         struct vvp_object *clobj = cl2vvp(clp->cp_obj);
00491 
00492         vvp_page_fini_common(vpg);
00493         atomic_dec(&clobj->vob_transient_pages);
00494 }
00495 
00496 static const struct cl_page_operations vvp_transient_page_ops = {
00497         .cpo_own                = vvp_transient_page_own,
00498         .cpo_assume             = vvp_transient_page_assume,
00499         .cpo_unassume           = vvp_transient_page_unassume,
00500         .cpo_disown             = vvp_transient_page_disown,
00501         .cpo_discard            = vvp_transient_page_discard,
00502         .cpo_fini               = vvp_transient_page_fini,
00503         .cpo_is_vmlocked        = vvp_transient_page_is_vmlocked,
00504         .cpo_print              = vvp_page_print,
00505         .io = {
00506                 [CRT_READ] = {
00507                         .cpo_prep       = vvp_transient_page_prep,
00508                         .cpo_completion = vvp_transient_page_completion,
00509                 },
00510                 [CRT_WRITE] = {
00511                         .cpo_prep       = vvp_transient_page_prep,
00512                         .cpo_completion = vvp_transient_page_completion,
00513                 }
00514         }
00515 };
00516 
00517 int vvp_page_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00518                 struct cl_page *page, pgoff_t index)
00519 {
00520         struct vvp_page *vpg = cl_object_page_slice(obj, page);
00521         struct page     *vmpage = page->cp_vmpage;
00522 
00523         CLOBINVRNT(env, obj, vvp_object_invariant(obj));
00524 
00525         vpg->vpg_page = vmpage;
00526         page_cache_get(vmpage);
00527 
00528         if (page->cp_type == CPT_CACHEABLE) {
00529                 /* in cache, decref in vvp_page_delete */
00530                 atomic_inc(&page->cp_ref);
00531                 SetPagePrivate(vmpage);
00532                 vmpage->private = (unsigned long)page;
00533                 cl_page_slice_add(page, &vpg->vpg_cl, obj, index,
00534                                 &vvp_page_ops);
00535         } else {
00536                 struct vvp_object *clobj = cl2vvp(obj);
00537 
00538                 cl_page_slice_add(page, &vpg->vpg_cl, obj, index,
00539                                 &vvp_transient_page_ops);
00540                 atomic_inc(&clobj->vob_transient_pages);
00541         }
00542         return 0;
00543 }
